meanings.definition: To calm or send to sleep, typically with soothing sounds or movements.
meanings.sent1: The gentle rocking of the cradle lulled the baby to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The soft music lulled me into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent3: The hypnotic dance of the flames lulled the campers into dreamland.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic sound of the waves lulling me into a state of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive tapping of the rain on the roof lulling the house into silence.

meanings.definition: To cause to feel safe or secure, often resulting in a false sense of security.
meanings.sent1: The false promises lulled him into a sense of security.
meanings.sent2: The locked door lulled her into thinking she was safe.
meanings.sent3: The old alarm system lulling the residents into a false sense of safety.
meanings.sent4: The calm before the storm lulling them into a dangerous complacency.
meanings.sent5: The familiar surroundings lulling them into a deceptive comfort.
